node.text: That's fine, but it'll cost ya.

option.optiontext: Barnsy said he'd owe you a case of whiskey.

node.text: Ye, but I prefer to get paid now.
Pfft, fine. What is it, his whiskey machine acting up again?

option.optiontext: He blew one of the tanks, been trying to bend it back into shape but the tools keep breaking.

node.text: Ye, of course they do. Thing's made of hardened Imbersteel, innit? It'd be better to just cast new wall plating entirely, 'course, that'd require a ton of Imbersteel...

option.optiontext: Isn't there any other way?
I take it Imbersteel isn't easily available?

node.text: Ye, I guess there is. Could make a heavy hammer out of Arakite. It's a rare metal with some weird properties. Heard they found some in the mines of Ratcliffe.

option.optiontext: You want me to find some from those mines then?
What makes Arakite special?

node.text: Ye, if ya want that hammer.

option.optiontext: As it happens, I'm already carrying some of that ore.
Okay, I'll be back with some ore.
Where do I find the Ratcliffe mines? Don't tell me it's far...

node.text: Well ye, I guess it's rare enough and takes skill to extract, so it'd be pretty pricey.

option.optiontext: Isn't there another way?

node.text: I dunno, it's too soft to be useful for most things, but it has a way of snapping back to shape without breaking. I guess wizards and crazy alchemists and such value it for some other reasons.

option.optiontext: So I should bring some of this Arakite to you?

node.text: Ye, well it ain't that far. Gotta follow the road leading southeast of Haywind, enter the mines and grab the ore, innit?

option.optiontext: Okay, I'll come back when I've found some.
I should have enough Arakite ore for the special hammer now.
So, what exactly should I do again?
Nevermind, I'd like to see your store.
Nevermind, I should go.

node.text: Ye alright then, gimme a moment and I'll cast it for ya.
*Forvan makes hamar cinematic?*
Here ya go, one Arakite Hammer. And don't forget to tell Barnsy I'll be expecting that whiskey crate shortly.

option.optiontext: Wouldn't mind having a look at what else you have for sale.
Thanks, I will.

node.text: Ye well, if yer looking to bend Barnsy's Imbersteel whiskey chambers back into shape, I reckon yer gonna need an Arakite hammer. I can make that for ya, if ya bring me the Arakite ore itself. Word is they found some in the Ratcliffe mines recently.

option.optiontext: And where do I find these Ratcliffe mines?
I see.

node.text: Follow the road leading southeast of Haywind to reach the mines. Then all ya gotta do is find the ore, grab it and bring it back here, innit?

option.optiontext: Alright, what have you got for sale?
I see.

node.text: Well alright then! Gimme a moment and I'll cast it into the hammer for ya.
Oh, hello there traveler. Sorry about the commotion, been trying to fix this damn machine for days now. So what brings you to Barnsy Barnsmill the IV? Let me guess, whiskey?

option.optiontext: That's right, looking for a bottle of the famous Mistywood Dew.

node.text: Or infamous, depending on how you look at it. This machine of mine churns out tons of the stuff, but it's... an acquired taste. The locals have grown to love it though.

But if you're looking for a bottle now, I have some bad news for you, mate. I've sold my stock and the distiller's broken. I tried to optimize the pressure, improve on the product you know? Got a bit too confident and blew this tank instead.

option.optiontext: But I really need that whiskey...
So can you fix it?

node.text: Need it? I hope you aren't one of those poor drunks addicted to the stuff. In any case, there isn't more until I get the machine running again. If you're really that keen, maybe you could help.

option.optiontext: What can I do?

node.text: It's simple actually. All we need is to bang the chamber wall back into place, but for that we need a tool that's not gonna break on us. If there's someone around with something like that, it'll be Forvan.

Forvan's the blacksmith in Haywind, best smith around these parts for sure, so he'll know what to do. Look for his forge outside the northern gates of Haywind and let him know I owe him a case of whiskey. That ought to do the trick.

option.optiontext: Okay, I'll see what I can do.
What's the quickest way to get there?
What's the story behind the whisky anyway?
How does the distiller contraption work?

node.text: It's not like I haven't tried but the chamber walls are cast from hardened Imbersteel. The idea is that Imbersteel wouldn't break, basically ever, but once it gives... Well, it's really hard to shape back together. You can ask my hammers all about it.

option.optiontext: But I really need that whiskey...

node.text: You'll probably have to go west and through the city; head north from Haywind marketplace and you shouldn't have trouble finding him.

option.optiontext: What's the story behind the whisky anyway?
How does the distiller contraption work?
Okay, I'll see what I can do.
Okay, I'll see what I can do.

node.text: Ooh well it all started with with my great-great-grandfather Barnsy Barnsmill the second. He was a bit of a tinker you see and he loved whiskey. Now, it was during the time of the Great Whiskey Shortage of the last century...

option.optiontext: How exciting.
Let's get back to the distiller. How does it work exactly?
Actually, tell me how to get to Forvan's forge.
Enlightening, but I should get on with the task at hand.
Enlightening, but I should get on with the task at hand.

node.text: Oh yeah! So whiskey prices were really high in Imberthale, while in neighboring Melloria they were pretty low. So people were traveling all the way across the border to buy whiskey! Let me tell you, whiskey prices... it's crazy stuff.

option.optiontext: What happened then? I'm on the edge of my seat here with these whiskey prices.
Let's get back to the distiller. How does it work exactly?
Actually, tell me how to get to Forvan's forge.
Enlightening, but I should get on with the task at hand.
Enlightening, but I should get on with the task at hand.

node.text: Well, good olde Barnsy Barnsmill got sick of it all and decided to make his own whiskey. Being the inventor that he was, he came up with this very special distiller. It could churn out such quantities of whiskey so fast that we were able to cart it off to Melloria and undercut our competition! Can you imagine?

option.optiontext: Your family must have made a fortune.
Let's get back to the distiller. How does it work exactly?
Actually, tell me how to get to Forvan's forge.
Enlightening, but I should get on with the task at hand.
Enlightening, but I should get on with the task at hand.

node.text: Aye but we're simple whiskey people, don't need too much in the way of luxuries. Granted, some of our family have used the whiskey fortunes to build impressive estates elsewhere. But I prefer to stay right here where it all started, making the very same whiskey my great-great-grandfather made.

option.optiontext: Let's get back to the distiller. How does it work exactly?
Actually, tell me how to get to Forvan's forge.
Enlightening, but I should get on with the task at hand.
Enlightening, but I should get on with the task at hand.

node.text: Now that's a family secret! But I can tell you it's powered by the massive windmill outside. It houses an intricate system of pipes that make their way down here to the distiller and provide it with all the water and pressure and stuff it needs.

option.optiontext: Um. So what's the story behind the whiskey then?
Okay, so what's the best way to get to Forvan's forge.
Nevermind, I should get on with the task at hand.
Nevermind, I should get on with the task at hand.

node.text: Try not to think about it too much. To laymen it all seems like magic anyway. The important thing to understand is that it just works.

option.optiontext: Um, so what's the story behind the whiskey then?
Okay, so what's the best way to get to Forvan's forge.
Nevermind, I should get on with the task at hand.
Nevermind, I should get on with the task at hand.
Got back from Forvan's forge. He came up with a special hammer that should do the trick.
What should I do again?
Just curious, what's the story behind the whiskey anyway?
Wondering how a machine like this can possibly produce whiskey.
Nothing right now.

node.text: That's terrific news! Let's see if it will get the plating back to place. Want to have the honors?
Find the smith Forvan in northern Haywind and ask him for a tool that will help us fix this chamber wall that blew loose. Tell him I'll owe him a case of whiskey, that ought to soften him up.

option.optiontext: And how do I get to his forge, exactly?
What's the story behind the whiskey anyway?
So how does this distiller work?

node.text: Pressure's still tanking, something must be wrong with the pipes. Check on the windmill outside while I fix things down here, would you?

If you see any broken pipes up there, you can try to fix them with the spare parts from crates at the base of the windmill. Pull the lever at the top once you get everything in order and it should get the machine running again.
Oh, what now?! Pressure's tanking? Something's wrong with the pipes... Check on the windmill outside while I fix things down here, would you?

If you see any broken pipes up there, try to fix them with the spare parts from crates at the base of the windmill. Pull the lever at the top once you get everything in order and it should get the machine running again.
Flipping egg mate, you did it! The whiskey taps are running again and you've certainly earned your bottle. Tell you what, take this too...

It's the recipe for an experiment I did a while back. Tried to come up with a new kind of liquor, but the stuff ended up tasting like horse piss. It's incredibly flammable though, so maybe an adventurer like you can find an alternative use for it.

option.optiontext: Alright, thanks.
Hold on, shouldn't the whiskey age before it's ready?

node.text: Nah, not the way this machine does it. Trust me, Mistywood Dew is perfect as it is.

option.optiontext: I'm beginning to wonder if this can be whiskey at all...
Um, if you say so... thanks anyway.

node.text: No, thank you. And remember friend; if you ever run out of whiskey, you're welcome here any time.

option.optiontext: I'll keep that in mind. Take care, Barns.

node.text: Heh, you wouldn't be the only one mate. But for most people it does the trick.

option.optiontext: Alright, thanks.

node.text: Greetings, friend! Whiskey machine's churning better than ever before, thanks to you. Now, how can I help?

option.optiontext: I was hoping to buy whiskey.
Nothing for now, take care Barns.

node.text: *Barnsy banging whisky chamber with hammer*
Hngh! Come on...! Get in there...!
*hamar braek*
Shit in a wet sock, piece of... gah! That was my best hammer!
You fix the chamber wall and I'll get the machine ready.
*palyer hits ting with hammer, barnsy pulls a lever or something*
*machine coughs steam everywheere*
Barnsy: *cough*
Player: *cough*
